candidates.title: feat: Massive Refactor and Rewrite
candidates.body:
One of the reasons why I always kept postponing patches and updates in this project was the fact that it was pretty hard to maintain. When I originally wrote most of it, I barely had time and just wanted to get features out ASAP.

The [Even Better TOML](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=tamasfe.even-better-toml) has recently passed the 100K installs mark, I felt that some cleanup and care was long overdue.

This PR is pretty much a rewrite and/or a major refactor of Taplo with the only exception of the parser, which I would love to rewrite as well but I'm already pushing my time-limits.

## Features

- [x] Rewrite of the DOM, it now uses a reference-counted implementation where each node is cheap to clone and to juggle around.
- [x] Rewrite of the CLI as well, it is now a first-class citizen not just something quickly thrown together.
- [x] Integration of [jsonschema](https://github.com/Stranger6667/jsonschema-rs), most (all?) JSON Schema features are now supported and the limitations of the current implementation are non-existent.
- [x] Support of [schema store](https://www.schemastore.org/json/) catalog and schemas
- [x] The shared code between the CLI and the language server is now properly extracted into `taplo-common`, so the CLI and the LSP are no longer out of sync.
- [x] The external environment is now abstracted away into a trait, so both the LSP and the CLI should run pretty much anywhere with minimal plumbing
- [x] [tracing](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing) is used for all logging
- [x] Refactor and workspace support in the LSP
- [x] All [toml-test](https://github.com/BurntSushi/toml-test) tests now pass
- [x] Proper benchmarks via criterion (the new DOM is slightly slower initially due to allocations, but not too much)
- [x] Completions and hover in the LSP (the building blocks are there, but the cursor queries require some plumbing)
- [ ] The LSP is part of the CLI as well, and the VSCode extension works with it, WASM bindings are yet to be reimplemented
- [x] Flexible configuration options in the LSP
- [x] Proper directives in TOML files (e.g. schema)

## Breaking Changes

Probably a lot, but here are a few notable ones:

- The DOM API is completely different, although migration should be rather easy.
- Chrono feature has been removed, it can be reintroduced later though if needed.
- As with the DOM layout, error types have also changed.
- Date types are now separate syntax-kinds.
- Even though we had no MSRV policy, I clearly used 1.58 features during the rewrite
- The Even Better Toml vscode extension also gets a facelift with some configuration options changed

Merging this PR should:

- close #3 
- close #205
- close #197
- close #196
- close #185
- close #181
- close #179
- close #176
- close #174 
- close #172
- close #167
- close #123
- close #136
- close #121
- close #120
- close #97
- close #57

candidates.title: Make it possible to use !Send even in Native LSP
candidates.body:
fixes #187

use `tokio::task::spawn_local` and remove `Send` requirements.

Note:
The use of multi-threaded executor is still exists in the following places:
- `create_input`
- `create_output`
- `taplo-cli`

candidates.title: Avoid panic if request position is out of mapper's range
candidates.body:
Sometimes Emacs lsp-mode sends a request containing a position parameter before synchronizing with `DidChangeTextDocument`.
At that time, the `mapper` may not be able to find the stored position and panicked with `unwrap`.
This fix is to return `Ok(None)` instead of `unwrap` to avoid this case.

Perhaps this may fix the problem like a https://github.com/golang/go/issues/48249 as well.


This PR includes commit of https://github.com/tamasfe/taplo/pull/184.

candidates.title: Move wasm-bindgen usage to a cargo feature to support building for Wasm without defining exports
candidates.body:
Hello! Thanks for this crate! I've been investigating a bunch of TOML parsers and found yours to be the best out of all the ones I tried. I'd like to use the parser in a Wasm build, but right now the crate adds wasm-bindgen exports, which isn't desirable when it's used internally by some other Wasm code.

After this change, the code should work the same as it currently does. I think though that eventually it should be flipped so that using wasm-bindgen is opt-in rather than opt-out.

Thanks! (Also, I've used the parser to create a code formatter... I understand that taplo has a built-in code formatter, but toml is such a simple language and I prefer full control over the output)

candidates.title: Formatter Rework
candidates.body:
PR for #123.

Notable changes include:

- we work with strings only (also removed SmolStr)
- better handling of comments with a generic trait
- simplified code where possible

TODO:
- [x] array formatting
- [x] generic `tabwriter` for vertical alignments (e.g. comments after values in multi-line arrays)
- [x] tests
- [x] <s>document new features</s> this shouldn't block this PR
- [x] reorganize, split code to multiple files if needed

candidates.title: Update assert-json-diff to 2.0
candidates.body:
Hey 👋 

I recently released assert-json-diff 2.0.0 which had [a few breaking changes](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200---2021-01-23).

candidates.title: Bump lsp-types version to match tower-lsp
candidates.body: Good afternoon, we would like to use taplo and some components from taplo's LSP to provide autocompletion for toml configuration in our linter's LSP. However, taplo uses a relatively old version of lsp-types which is incompatible with tower-lsp. This PR bumps the version of lsp-types to match tower-lsp

chosen_pr.title: feat: Massive Refactor and Rewrite
chosen_pr.body:
One of the reasons why I always kept postponing patches and updates in this project was the fact that it was pretty hard to maintain. When I originally wrote most of it, I barely had time and just wanted to get features out ASAP.

The [Even Better TOML](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=tamasfe.even-better-toml) has recently passed the 100K installs mark, I felt that some cleanup and care was long overdue.
